data.title: Forget the breakfast
data.text:
This facility misrepresents itself in its advertisement. It claims to serve breakfast, but "breakfast" is a waffle served by the resident caretaker, Byron. He is an incredible host, very engaging in conversation, but really, I paid for breakfast but I did not get anything remotely resembling breakfast. The excuse is that the local Massachusetts Bay authority does not allow them to make breakfast, or that the guests may NOT turn on a kitchen appliance. That, according to the inn, is deemed a violation of the bylaws. I feel cheated.

The room itself was very quiet, comfortable, great wi-fi. The common bathroom was less than appealing. The paint, the walls have definitely seen better days. They need a major overhaul. I found myself having to walk to Harvard Market to see to breakfast and dinner.

data.title: Here for Boston marathon
data.text:
Great place to stay for our whole family to participate and watch the Boston Marathon.
Close to the Harvard Square subway station able to take the red line straight to the loading and finish area in Boston Commons
Karen and Doan are great host with a great breakfast to start your day.
The rooms are nice with a very much family feel.

data.title: Feeling ripped-off and deceived by description
data.text:
I stayed in this B&B about a month ago. 
We booked it following great reviews, and the only thing I can say is that we were extremely disappointed. 
When we arrived at the address we were surprised at how shabby the house was. It looked like it hasn’t been renovated since the Victorian times. The interior proved to be much worse. 
The B&B was on the 3rd floor, so we had to haul our suitcases up a narrow, dusty staircase. Upon our arrival on the 3rd floor we had to navigate a very narrow, dark and dusty corridor to our room. Our room was even worse, but before we could even look around the manager insisted on us paying “upon arrival”. If we had any choice we would have left immediately, but we were tired after a long flight and we didn’t know where else to go.
Bottom line; we stayed and suffered. Our room was full of old, worn-out furniture which had nothing to do with antiques as they had advertised. The beds were simply uncomfortable (mattresses and pillows need to be replaced). Everything was dusty, and the window frame and the armchair had layers of dirt on them. Under a chest of drawers there was a box with a fire escape equipment which had about 2cm of dust on it. The curtains on the windows and over the bed were dusty as well, the air-conditioning unit old, dirty and loud. The bathroom was shared and in a Victorian condition as well. Every time you had a shower you could be sure to find interesting leftovers of your predecessor in the bathtub. The garbage bin in the bathroom wasn’t emptied for several days. The ironing board was so incredibly dirty and ancient that we just gave up any thought of using it.  The kitchen was doubling as the common room and the laundry room. The cabinets were beyond cleaning and there were wires hanging about. The porch was full of old, broken equipment and furniture and the chairs and table were simply dirty. 
This B&B was definitely not a place to feel comfortable in. 
The only highlight was the live-in manager, who was always very entertaining and helpful. He prepared a fresh and home-made breakfast every day, which could have varied more, but was nevertheless delicious. 
For what it offered, this place was definitely a rip-off. It is always a question of what you get and what you were promised for your money, and in this B&B we certainly didn’t get what we had been promised.

data.title: Low standard, overpriced, good location
data.text: I booked this B&B based on the great reviews and got seriously disappointed. The standard has obviously dropped since those reviews were written. The place was not clean, beds uncomfortable, bathroom not cleaned regularly. The towels were not changed in 5 days. This could be a great place because of the location (few minutes to Harvard Square) but because of the hygiene standards I cannot recommend it. It was also seriously overpriced (188 $ per night). As to the antiques, they are simply old furniture. Bathroom is shared and there is only one toilet. Shower is just a spray.  Air-conditioning was very old and loud, but the street is louder when you open the windows. The back porch was very uninviting. There is no common room, only the kitchen as common area. Positive: The  live-in manager was very helpful with tips about the area and his breakfast was good, but it could be more varied.  I complained to the owners about the state of the B&B and they promised that they would fix all the problems, so hopefully they will do that. Until then, I can only advise to stay somewhere else.

data.title: Best place to stay in Cambridge
data.text:
The only reason that this doesn't get 5 stars is that it is way overpriced. With those rates, one would expect a fancy hotel, but this B&B offers something quite different than that. Which is not necessarily a bad thing.
Location is great, with a 10 minute walk to Harvard Square, metro, and restaurants. With only three rooms, you actually get a chance to get to know the other guests. There is a shared bathroom, but it is very clean and organized. Rooms are very cosy, with great Wifi connection. The vegetarian/organic breakfast is amazing and gives you an opportunity to talk to the manager Byron who will make you feel that this is your home away from home. 
The building is old, there is nothing luxurious about the rooms, and the walls are quite thin, but the hospitality is out of this world. Highly recommended.

data.title: Comfortable & charming
data.text:
A Bed & Breakfast in Cambridge is a lovely B&B set on the 3rd floor of a traditional home. My son & I spent 5 days there while exploring the city.
- Room: our room felt smallish because we had 2 twin beds, however it was extremely comfortable. In particular the bedding is super nice with down comforters and pillows. The room was very quiet and we (over) slept supremely well. The towels we were given were thick and most excellent. We had lace curtains and antique furniture. 
- Floor: There were 2 other rented rooms on the same floor and we shared a common bathroom. This was never a problem. The bathroom was very well maintained. If a guest wanted to reserve it for a shower at a specific time, there was a small chalkboard where they could write their need.
- Innkeepers & service: the inn was managed by the owners Doane & Karen, and the innkeeper Byron. They were very attentive, available, and very interesting conversationalists. They know the city very well and can give you advice. Doane & Karen were away for part of our stay, and Byron did a splendid job. putting us at ease, cooking the delicious food, and going out of his way if we needed something. Breakfast was served at 8:30am and prepared fresh every morning: consisted of homemade delicious healthy items: crepes or corn flapjacks with yogurt, homemade jam or marmalade, pure maple syrup, fresh fruit as well as coffee of course and an assortment of tea choices. We appreciated a bit of flexibility in the timing of breakfast as we were catching up on sleep.
- Amenities: in the hallway of the 3rd floor there was a small library of resources related to the city and to Massachusetts: maps, guide books, pamphlets etc We used one of the books to plan an outing to the North End and look up the Freedom Trail. I enjoyed in particular leafing through a book on the local architecture. There is a gym just across the street that welcomes non-members after 6pm for a $6 fee (they have exercise and weight machines, and a swimming pool). That was very convenient. The wifi internet connection was reliable and very fast.
- Location. The location is a great asset. The B&B is a 5 minute walk from Harvard Square, walking through the Harvard Yard. Coming into the city, we had a free ride on the Subway from the Airport. Harvard Square has countless nice restaurants, bookstores, small shops as well as street performers. From there it is very easy to catch the subway to any other part of the city. Cambridge/Boston also have a well established bus system so it was very easy to get anywhere. 
If we visit Boston/Cambridge again we would love to stay again at the Cambridge B&B.

data.title: Hospitality
data.text: It is obvious that Byron's, Karen's and Doane's passion is hospitality. During our stay they listened, facilitated and helped us to find our way in the B&B, Cambridge, and the surroundings. We had booked the West-room which is on the back of the house next to the kitchen and in front of the bathroom. The rooms were very clean and cosy. We had good nights' sleep. At the breakfast we were nicely surprised and enjoyed of a freshly and delicious gently-simmered poached pears as starter and home-made and crispy baked Craps (crepes) rolled around banana slices and served along with yogurt and strawberry sauce. Heaven on Earth! We stayed for a week and therefore had the chance to taste the yellow and blue corn versions of the crepes. Our stay in Cambridge was, in particular, special because Byron was very helpful and had interesting and engaging conversations during the breakfast on health, history and life. He is a great cook and professional lodging-house keeper. He was also very flexible and kind with the time of the breakfast. Early breakfast was carefully and on-time served such that we could attend the conference avoiding the traffic congestion. We also got three worthy advices on places to visit: the Walden Pond, the USS Constitution Museum and the Restaurant ‘Tu y yo’ in Somerville. These places were easy to reach given the strategical location of the house. We had great time and hope to be back.

data.title: Great Stay
data.text: I had a great time here during my stay in September. Byron was very helpful and made sure that our stay was as good as it was. The breakfast was great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone looking for a place in Cambridge or Boston area. The public transit is also very good making it easy to get around town,

data.title: Warm, friendly, quirky and welcoming
data.text:
I spent a week staying at this B & B for a work trip- and I'd strongly recommend it to others. 

 IT's a beautiful old building, located in one of the most picturesque parts of Boston, and walking distance from great restaurants and Harvard Sq. 

The owners and the manager also really care about you having a good experience, and making you feel welcome. 

The B&Bs real secret weapon though is Byron, who is the live-in manager. 

Each morning he personally cooks each guest a delicious breakfast of blueberry crepes or corn pancakes- and takes care to make sure that the recipe is adjusted exactly to  taste. Far more care and quality than I would normally expect at a Bed and Breakfast of this type- and really made me feel welcome as a visitor. 

It 's true that there is only one shared bathroom for all the guests and Byron- and this might be a problem for some visitors - but it is kept scrupulously clean. The rooms are also not particularly large - again as you would expect for this price. 

For me, this is small price to pay for a really excellent, quirky and welcoming place.

data.title: B&B-Worth-staying-Inn
data.text: Having travelled for 24 hours in total from Ha Noi, Viet Nam to Cambridge, I finally landed in the small  but cosy B&B late in the evening and was wellcomed by Byron Jordan. He gave me the opportunity to choose the room and advised me which room was less noisy. I immediately felt like I was at home with care from my family members and this feeling was with me for the whole period of my 6-night stay. It was Byron who prepared delicious crepes for me each morning at a very unusual early time and he has kindly took me around Harvard Square the first morning when knowing that I was very bad at reading map. I miss those breakfasts at B&B and friendly chat we had. I also miss the way Byron carefully  washed his hand each time prior to preparing breakfast, the time he asked me to flip over the crepe together with him when I seem to be very interested in watching him. Those gestures might be simple to many people but to me, they add values to my daily life and convince me that happiness is simple things around us and that it is not neceesary that we always have to pursuit or look for luxurious things. I will for sure choose B&B should i have another chance to come back to Cambride. Until then see you Byron!

data.title: Highly recommended!
data.text: Suddenly without a place to stay, I was fortunate enough to get a room at "A B  & B in Cambridge". The guesthouse exceeded my expectation, to say the least. The staff is super friendly and serves guests delicious crepés for breakfast! Everything is neat and clean; my room was good and the kitchen a clean and cozy place. While I stayed, it was very warm in Boston (around 30°C) but a controllable AC in my room made sure I felt good the whole time. The wi-fi is better than in most hotels I've stayed in, and the location is perfect - almost on the Harvard campus. I would definitely recommend the place to anybody looking for a friendly place to stay in Boston.

data.title: Friendly!
data.text: Rooms are hard to come by during graduation month! Our daughter found this non-descript B&B, and they had a room available for our six-day stay! The outside of this B&B is very non-descript. You would not even know a B&B resided inside! The room we occupied was very comfy, as well as nicely appointed. The bed was very comfortable (I think it was a memory foam high-end mattress). But the real character of this B&B was in the folks who manage it! Byron was the initial staff member we encountered. He was a flat gas! Way fun in every respect. Great conversationalist, outstanding cook and he kept everything sparkling clean. Karen, the owner, was just as engaging. She also was a treasure of knowlege. Good times; we will go back!!!

data.title: Last Minute B&B
data.text: We needed to take a spur of the moment trip up to Cambridge (from  Long Island).  We were going to book a hotel, but found this B&B instead.  The rate was more reasonable than the hotels, and just a few blocks from Harvard.  Really conveniently located.  We booked a queen bed room, but they upgraded us to a king at no charge.  The room was beautiful.  Lace curtains, antique furniture.  Byron, the caretaker, cooked wonderful breakfasts and engaged us in fascinating conversation.  The shared bathroom was not the issue I was anticipating it would be.  Parking in the neighborhood was a bit more challenging due to the snow, but the free spots in front of the house opened up in the evening.  Our stay was totally enjoyable and we will be returning very soon.  A+++

data.title: Friendly B&B in a great location.
data.text:
Great location, right near Harvard, and a short walk from the Harvard Square T station. The B&B is on the third floor of a beautiful old Cambridge brownstone.  The staff was friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed the interesting conversation over breakfast.  The room was clean, with free wi-fi and TV.  The bed was comfortable, the shared bathroom was well-appointed, and we never saw anybody waiting.  We really felt taken care of.

Parking can be challenging in Cambridge, but if you get lucky, there are a few free spots right in front of the building, and the nearby metered parking is free after 6 PM.

Really loved the place, and we hope to go back.

data.title: A unique Harvard experience
data.text: If you're looking for a glossy, face-less hotel, this isn't it. If you insist on en-suite and 'all you can eat' breakfasts, this won't suit you at all. But we certainly weren't looking for these things. We wanted character, a warm welcome, freedom and creative inspiration and this B and B delivered in spades. The third floor of a Cambridge town house, this apartment was comfortable and relaxed. There is a shared bathroom but it is immaculately clean and there was never a 'queue for the loo'. Art publications abound and the paintings on the wall reflect the creative personalities of the owners. Breakfast was prepared by Byron who inspired us with fascinating conversation whilst flipping crepes and pouring coffee. It's not fast food, thank goodness. Location-wise, it's a five minute walk to Harvard Yard (and the nearest T stop) so it's super-convenient. Price-wise it was very competitive compared with any other accommodation with the available dates. So, if you're creative, open-minded, sociable and curious this is just the place for you. If not, there are plenty of bland hotels to choose from !

data.title: A Home Away from Home!
data.text:
"A true home away from  home! A B&B in Cambridge is a warm and welcoming environment that lacks all feeling of transiency. An ideal solution for a weary traveler.  
 Hosts Doane Perry and Karen Carmean are respected members of the Cambridge Community for more than 30 yrs. Thoughtful, kind and helpful. Genuinely concerned about the safety and well-being of each guest. Perfect accommodations for academics and the parents of college students! Hosts will be warmly remembered and appreciated! A B&B in Cambridge is a short, straight walk down Cambridge street that leads straight in to Harvard Yard! Lesley College is nearby.  If you are relocating to Cambridge this is a perfect place to stay! Lovely rooms. Antique bedroom sets!The most confortable bed on which I have ever slept! Plush sets of matching towels and bathmats, matched linen sets, lovely quilts.Delicious breakfasts, home made preserves and jams that included a variety of teas and coffee. If you have special dietary needs, advise the host. My stay at A B&B in Cambridge was the beginning a very special time in my life, that otherwise would have been very stressful. Many thanks and good wishes to the hosts and their wonderful staff. My first purchase for my new home in Cambridge will be one of the hosts paintings. Her artwork is displayed on the walls . A lovely remembrance of my wonderful stay at A B& B in Cambridge.

data.title: Nice and friendly ambience. Feels like home.
data.text: Thanks for all. I enjoyed my stay at your B&B a lot. Nice conversations, yammi breakfast, clean rooms, all located in a very good area. Very friendly people. It really felt like home. Hope to be back there again.

data.title: It's clean and the location is great!
data.text: The room is clean also the bathroom and  everything, though there's only one bathroom for all guests. The breakfast is very good, way better than expected. The best thing is the location, 7-10 minutes walk to Harvard square station and the bus stop is right in front of the place. I really enjoyed my stay and thanks for the kindness of Karen and Byron. I totally reccommend this place.

data.title: DISCLAIMER: Only 1 Bathroom, shared with innkeeper AND staff
data.text:
The single bathroom situation, shared with 6 people (one being the innkeeper), was an immediate deal breaker.  If the owners had been in town, we would have had 8 people sharing one bathroom.  We tried to leave, but all the hotels in the area were booked because of college students moving in!  Since our group occupied all three available rooms, at least we weren't sharing a bathroom with people we didn't know (except the staff).  I would not recommend this place if your group does not occupy all of the rooms.

We were attending a conference across the street, so this was a little close for coworkers.  The location, just outside of Harvard Square, was ideal for our conference, but we found ourselves using the bathroom at the conference instead of the place we were paying to stay!

The B&B occupies the 3rd floor of an unmarked apartment building.  There was old Victorian charm, but it seemed a little grungy.  I checked for bedbugs, found none, but realized why the beds were so "comfortable."  Layers upon layers of egg crate with a mattress on plywood!  I also came home with a few VERY ITCHY spider bits.  The last few mornings, we began to find things out of place in our room.  We realized the innkeeper was watching T.V. in our room.  Our room was not tidied each day, so we're not sure why this was happening.  On the final day, or linens were changed for the next group and bags moved around, even before checkout time!  A little too personal for me!

Breakfast was wonderful but a little redundant.  Cornmeal pancakes 3 days and banana and yogurt crepes 2 days.  Breakfast was served in the one, yes just one, common room- a 10x10 kitchen.  We often took to the back porch, which was littered with kitchen appliances, junk, and dirty chairs.  

We felt this place was not worth the money or the hassle.  We could have stayed at the Hampton Inn for the same price, and wished it was available!  If you are looking for a quaint, romantic, B&B, this is not it.

data.title: Delicious and Wonderful experience
data.text: I spent a great week at the B & B in Cambridge. I felt very welcomed by the staff. The best part of my stay was the excellent directions that I received from Karen during my time in Cambridge and Boston. She asked me what my interests were in terms of sightseeing and then gave accurate directions to get to the museums and restaurants. I usually have problems sleeping the first night away from home, but the bed was very comfortable. The breakfast each morning was delicious and filling. Byron is quite a cook. He also helped me to feel right at home.
